declaration.paragraph1: Insee is committed to making its websites, intranet, extranet, and its software accessible (and its mobile applications and digital urban furniture) in accordance with Article 47 of Law No. 2005-102 of February 11, 2005.
declaration.paragraph2Prefix: To this end, it implements a multi-year plan setting out INSEE's digital accessibility policy and a
declaration.paragraph2LinkText: INSEE's multi-year digital accessibility plan for 2023-2025
declaration.paragraph2LinkTitle: INSEE's multi-year digital accessibility plan for 2023-2025 - opens in a new window

conformityStatus.title: Conformity Status
conformityStatus.middle: is partially compliant with the general accessibility improvement guidelines
conformityStatus.rgaaLinkTitle: General accessibility improvement guidelines - opens in a new window
conformityStatus.suffix: , version 4.1.2, due to the non-conformities and derogations listed below.

testResults.title: Test Results
testResults.koenaLinkTitle: https://koena.net/ - opens in a new window
testResults.criterion1: 71% of RGAA criteria are met. This is the number of criteria fully met across all pages in the sample. This is also referred to as the overall compliance rate.
testResults.criterion2: The average compliance rate for the online service is 80%. This is the average compliance score obtained on each of the pages in the sample.
testResults.auditGridLinkText: Access to the RGAA audit grid
testResults.auditGridLinkTitle: RGAA audit grid - downloadable file - opens in a new window

nonAccessibleContent.title: Non-Accessible Content
nonAccessibleContent.nonCompliantIntro: We list below all non-compliant criteria. For details, refer to the audit grid and the multi-year plan for continuous improvement.
criteria: 5.3 — For each formatting table, does the linearized content remain understandable?
6.1 — Is each link explicit (except in special cases)?
7.3 — Can each script be controlled using the keyboard and any pointing device (except in special cases)?
7.4 — For each script that initiates a context change, is the user notified or does the user have control over it?
7.5 — On each web page, are status messages correctly rendered by assistive technologies?
8.6 — For each web page with a page title, is that title relevant?
10.8 — For each web page, is hidden content intended to be ignored by assistive technologies?
11.2 — Is each label associated with a form field relevant (except in special cases)?
11.7 — In each form, is each caption associated with a group of fields of the same type relevant?
11.10 — Is input validation used appropriately in each form (except in special cases)?
12.7 — Does each web page have a skip link or quick access link to the main content area (except in special cases)?
13.1 — For each web page, does the user have control over each time limit that modifies the content (except in special cases)?
13.3 — On each web page, does each downloadable office document have an accessible version, if necessary (except in special cases)?
13.11 — On each web page, can actions triggered by pointing to a single point on the screen be canceled (except in special cases)?

nonSubmittedContent.title: Content Not Subject to Accessibility Obligation
nonSubmittedContent.content: No content subject to legal exemption.

establishment.title: Establishment of this Accessibility Statement
establishment.content: This statement was made on October 6, 2025.

technologiesUsed.title: Technologies Used for the Site Development
technologiesUsed.intro: The following technologies are used on the website:

testEnvironment.title: Test Environment
testEnvironment.intro: Web page testing was performed using the following combinations of web browsers and screen readers:

evaluationTools.title: Accessibility Evaluation Tools
evaluationTools.intro: The following tools were used during the evaluation:
tools: RGAA extension published by DINUM for Firefox
Contrast-Finder and Color Contrast Analyzer to test color contrasts.

tools.linkTitle: W3C Validator - opens in a new window

tools: HeadingsMap extension for Firefox, to visualize the structure of headings.

tools.text: Web Developer browser extension by Chris Pederick:
tools.linkTitle: Web Developer browser extension - opens in a new window

tools.text: ARCtoolkit on Chrome for many criteria:

tools.linkTitle: PDF Accessibility - opens a new window

evaluatedPages.title: Pages of the Site That Have Been Verified for Conformity
evaluatedPages.randomSampleContent: In accordance with the RGAA: “randomly selected pages representing at least 10% of the pages in the sample described above are added.” This service did not allow pages to be selected at random. 100% of the steps in the questionnaire were evaluated.

feedbackContact.title: Feedback and Contact
feedbackContact.contentPrefix: If you are unable to access content or a service, you can contact support to be directed to an accessible alternative or to obtain the content in another form.
feedbackContact.linkTitle: Contact us - opens a new window

recourse.title: Recourse
recourse.intro: If you notice an accessibility defect preventing you from accessing content or a functionality of the site, you can report it and if you do not receive a response, you are entitled to send your complaints or a request to the Defender of Rights.

links.text: Write a message to the Defender of Rights (via the contact form)
Contact the Defender of Rights delegate in your region

recourse.mailPrefix: Send a letter by mail (free, no stamp required) to the following address:
recourse.phone: Contact the Defender of Rights by phone: 09 69 39 00 00.
